description: Understanding why JavaScript is challenging and how this workshop provides the foundation to confidently start building real projects.
Understanding that making mistakes is normal and part of the learning process in programming.
Basic tools you need to download to follow along with JavaScript development.
Installing and using the Live Server extension for faster web development.
Setting up Prettier for automatic code formatting and understanding its benefits.
Understanding what JavaScript is and why it's essential for modern development.
Setting up your development environment and writing your very first JavaScript program.
Understanding the different ways to load JavaScript and how they affect page performance.
Learn about JavaScript's fundamental primitive data types (number, string, boolean) and the basic operations you can perform with them.
Learn how to create variables in JavaScript using the let keyword and understand how variables store values in memory.
Learn how to create constants using the const keyword and understand when to use const instead of let for unchanging values.
Learn about JavaScript's special values null and undefined, understand their differences, and know when to use each one.
Learn how to create and use functions in JavaScript to organize your code and avoid repetition.
Learn how to pass functions to other functions as arguments, including callbacks and anonymous functions.
Learn the alternate arrow function syntax - a shorter way to write functions in JavaScript with some unique features.
Learn how JavaScript organizes variables and functions into different scopes, and how inner scopes can access outer scopes but not vice versa.
Learn how JavaScript moves function declarations to the top of their scope.
Learn how inner functions can access variables from outer scopes, even after the outer function has finished executing.
Learn about the var keyword and why you should avoid it in favor of let and const.
Learn how JavaScript automatically converts between types and how to prevent unexpected behavior with proper equality operators.
Learn about NaN (Not a Number) and how to properly check for it in JavaScript.
Learn how JavaScript handles equality comparisons and the importance of using strict equality.
Learn how to create and work with arrays to store multiple values in a single variable.
Learn how to create and work with objects to organize related data and functions together.
Learn the crucial difference between how JavaScript handles primitive values versus object references.
Learn how to use template literals (backticks) to create dynamic strings with embedded variables and expressions.
Learn how the this and new keywords work in JavaScript, including their uses in classes, objects, and different contexts.
Learn how to conditionally execute code using if, else if, and else statements.
Learn how to write concise conditional logic using the ternary operator for simple if-else scenarios.
Learn how to use switch statements for cleaner multi-way conditional logic and how to create scoped blocks for each case.
Learn how to use for loops to repeat code a specific number of times and iterate over data structures.
Learn how to use while loops for repeating code when you don't know exactly how many times to loop.
Learn how recursion works - when functions call themselves to solve problems that can be broken down into smaller, similar subproblems.
Learn how short-circuit evaluation works with logical operators to write more efficient and cleaner conditional code.
Learn essential array methods like forEach, map, filter, find, some, every, and reduce to work with arrays efficiently in JavaScript.
Learn about the window and document objects - the foundation for interacting with web pages in JavaScript.
Learn different ways to select HTML elements in JavaScript, including getElementById, getElementsByClassName, and the powerful querySelector methods.
Learn how to make your web pages interactive by adding event listeners to respond to user actions like clicks, form submissions, and more.
Learn about event delegation, event bubbling, and event capturing - powerful concepts that allow you to handle events efficiently and work with dynamically added elements.
Learn how to navigate through the DOM tree using JavaScript to move from one element to related elements like parents, children, and siblings.
Learn to identify and fix the most common JavaScript errors that beginners encounter, including syntax errors, runtime errors, and logical mistakes.
Learn to use Chrome DevTools effectively for debugging JavaScript, including the Elements, Console, Network, and Performance tabs.
Master advanced console methods and debugging techniques beyond basic console.log for more effective JavaScript debugging.
Master the Sources tab and JavaScript debugger in Chrome DevTools for advanced debugging with breakpoints, stepping, and call stack inspection.
Learn how to debug JavaScript directly in VSCode using the integrated debugger, launch configurations, and debugging features.
